relation: Great for these types of students
Great for students who like a challenge, but also like to have fun, participate with other students and the community, and enjoy their selves.
Search for plenty of scholarships and grants, and be prepared for an in depth, broad learning experience.
Quite expensive, but definitely worth it. It is a very respectable school, with a great reputation and wonderful education and career opportunities.

There are a lot of clubs to join, things to do, and places to go. Cafes are restaurants are located on campus, as well as a theater, volleyball court and basketball court next to dorms, and even the gym where their big games take place. Students get discounts and sometimes even free tickets to these games. Great architecture and a lot of space. It's like a city inside a city.
Professors are very dedicated, and will stay to help with any questions. Classes are very small, and I hear the work is challenging and keeps you interested.
